head.title: Encounter at the Gas Pump: Some Views About What to Do

hedline.hl1: Encounter at the Gas Pump: Some Views About What to Do

abstract.p: Victor Mazmanian letter responds to Peter Applebome's July 23 column on loud, obscene rap music played by man at gas pump (S)

block.p: Many readers responded to Peter Applebome's July 23 Soapbox column about racial mores and suburban manners at a gas station in Westchester County. The problem the column posed was what, if anything, to say to or do about the black gentleman sharing his expletive-laden music with the world and also Mr. Applebome's 9-year-old daughter.
Here is a sampling of readers' reactions.

As an African-American mother of a teenage son I found your article provocative. Do you think I want my son listening to that type of music at a light or gas station? I didn't see in your article the idea that there are parents of color who do not want their kids exposed to that stuff either!

The problem the column posed was what, if anything, to say to or do about the black gentleman sharing his expletive-laden music with the world and also Mr. Applebome's 9-year-old daughter.
Here is a sampling of readers' reactions.

As an African-American mother of a teenage son I found your article provocative. Do you think I want my son listening to that type of music at a light or gas station? I didn't see in your article the idea that there are parents of color who do not want their kids exposed to that stuff either!
Isn't that racist on your part? Do you confront the co-worker who makes a remark about a Jew? Do you confront a skinhead hanging out spouting his brand of hate? Is the question here really race?

Believe me, I face many more of these situations than you do. My child is also more vulnerable than yours, given the set-up of this society. What do I do? I turn it into teaching/ learning moments, which I've done from the beginning. And, F.Y.I., I have confronted armed, pit-bull-accompanied drug dealers and told them to get away from my house several times. I have experience with both approaches and I'm not sure what works best, but unlike you, I can't afford to be squeamish.
